reviews.text: Just a regular train station in Buxton. Not much really to say, there is a toilet and a ticket office inside. Other than that good station.
Lovely rock garden in station,  clearly an effort is made to enhance the station

The end of the line for the journey between Manchester and Southport with a 1/2 hourly service during the week and hourly on Sunday - the journey takes about an hour

Waiting room is open when it is staffed and also there are toilets there too

Staff on the train were good too with ticket checks

The station is near the centre of Buxton so good for either a stay or the local buses

With the photos you can see that at one stage this was a really fantastic building at the time which has now been run down

The worst customer service I have ever had thanks to the gentleman who sells the tickets in the office. 
He was rude and did nothing to help when i had a simple question/issue with my ticket. 
Even when I spoke to him politely through the glass he never looked at me and just walked away when he decided that he'd had enough. Awful employee
Always a great place to visit
